intro: Olearia pannosa subsp. pannosa, commonly known as the silver flax-leaf daisy, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It is characterized by its silvery, woolly leaves and showy yellow flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows in coastal and subalpine regions, preferring well-drained soils and full sun. It is part of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is known for its ornamental value in gardens. Olearia pannosa subsp. pannosa is also valued for its ecological role in supporting native pollinators.
